settings.title: Best Hairpiece for Men
settings.subtitle: Here at LaVivid, our company has its own factory which has more than 20 years experience in the hair industry. We are committed to delivering the best hair pieces for men who are experiencing hair loss. We provide premium quality products for competitive prices. Also we offer people with a variety of hair piece options in different bases including lace base, skin base, and mono/skin/lace combination base.

settings.title: Glue for Men’s Hairpiece
settings.subtitle: At LaVivid, you can get hairpiece glues from brand Walker tape and Professional hair lab. Please kindly note that when you apply glue.

settings.question: How much does a hairpiece cost?
settings.answer:
Here at LaVivid, we have different hairpiece models which cost differently ranging from $200 to $900. A few main factors that can affect the price of a hairpiece include the hair material, the time used to make a hairpiece, and the ventilation technique.

When it comes to hair material, European hair is the best quality and thus most expensive hair material on the market. Indian hair is mostly used for hair pieces. Synthetic hair is also used as gray hair for hair pieces.

The time for making a hairpiece also affects the price hugely. Making a full lace base requires a lot more time than that with a full skin base. So lace base hair pieces are more expensive than skin ones.

settings.question: How long does a men’s hairpiece last?
settings.answer:
The lifespan of a hairpiece depends on many things including the base material, base structure, hair material and your routine to care/maintain the hairpiece. Generally speaking, the thicker or stronger the base it, the longer it will last.

For all LaVivid stock hair pieces, different models last differently ranging from 2 months to 9 months.

The way how you care for your hairpiece can affect the lifespan greatly. For a super thin skin hairpiece, an experienced hairpiece wearer can use 6 months out of it while a beginner user can only get one month time of using. Wearing a hairpiece is a learning process and learning plus practices make you an expert.

settings.question: Men’s hairpiece installation
settings.answer:
·Locate where your hairline begins and the hair loss area

·Shave off the hair from this area

·Wash your head to make sure there isn’t any residue left on the head

·Prepare the hairpiece, bonding products and installation tools

·Clean the scalp with an alcohol swab and apply glue to the scalp.

·Apply the hairpiece to your head.

·Cut/style the hairpiece to a certain hairstyle and blend in with your own hair.

settings.question: Can I shower with a hairpiece?
settings.answer: Yes! Your can shower with a hairpiece but please don’t rub the hairpiece as what you do with your bio hair. When you shampoo the hair, use a wide-tooth comb and comb the shampoo through the hair following the hair direction. Always follow the hair direction while you condition and rinse the hairpiece.

settings.faq_subtitle: The majority of men will experience varying degrees of hair loss or balding in their lifetime. Some guys even start to loose their hair in their 20s and 4 out of 5 men will have major hair loss in their 50s. Hair loss can cause a devastating damage to a man’s confidence. A hairpiece is a good option to cover hair loss and regain a good look.Wearing a hairpiece is also the most economic, non-surgical, easy and safe choice to disguise baldness.

  • MA Massimo
    March 11, 2022
    Amazing quality

    I've started losing my hair since the age of 19, as you can imagine it was a big hit on my confidence, when you are so young you have too many things to worry about, and hair loss is something you really don't want to add to that list. I started using medication (minoxidil and finisteride) but they stopped working, and at the age of 24 I decided to undergo to a hair transplant. Every thing was going great until I started to lose my hair again and that's where I noticed that the HT was botched and I couldn't even shave my hair due to the scars left by the surgeon. I started using copious amount of concealers to cover my bald spots until I finally took the decision to try hair systems. I honestly have to say that it wasn't an easy journey. The first one I had was a junky and faulty rug provided by an hair saloon that charged me a fortune. I hated it so much that I changed it after a month and a half. The second one was from an online shop and still wasn't good enough, the hair was coarse and dry and it looked fake. I was about to give up until I came across LAVIVID HAIR, and it was a game changer! My first unit was Helios, full Swiss lace, and I could immediately notice the amazing quality of the hair, and master craftsmanship that goes on making those pieces. Soft hair, easy to style and to maintain and very natural hairline. I am currently wearing a Mirage thin skin poly and I can just say that I LOVE IT! I can style my hair however I want (even if I love my right parted quiff and I stick with that), the hairline is so undetectable and is a peace of mind. It's easy to maintain so it suits my lifestyle and it rarely tangles.
    I can certainly say that I'll be a LaVivid Hair customer from now on and I'll never change it.
    Thank you!
